Attributes

Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RANGE_CHECK
Description Name: Range Check
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether to validate attribute values and function parameters. If enabled, the instrument driver validates the parameter values that you pass to driver functions. Range checking parameters is very useful for debugging. After you validate your program, you can set this attribute to VI_FALSE to disable range checking and maximize performance.
The default value is VI_TRUE. Use the tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050002
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_QUERY_INSTRUMENT_STATUS
Description Name: Query Instrument Status
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether the instrument driver queries the instrument status after each operation. Querying the instrument status is very useful for debugging. After you validate your program, you can set this attribute to VI_FALSE to disable status checking and maximize performance
The instrument driver can choose to ignore status checking for particular attributes regardless of the setting of this attribute.
The default value is VI_FALSE. Use the tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050003
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_CACHE
Description Name: Cache
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether to cache the value of attributes. When caching is enabled, the instrument driver keeps track of the current instrument settings and avoids sending redundant commands to the instrument. Thus, you can significantly increase execution speed.
The instrument driver can choose always to cache or never to cache particular attributes regardless of the setting of this attribute.
The default value is VI_TRUE. Use the tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050004
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SIMULATE
Description Name: Simulate
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether or not to simulate instrument driver I/O operations. If simulation is enabled, instrument driver functions perform range checking and call Ivi_GetAttribute and Ivi_SetAttribute functions, but they do not perform instrument I/O. For output parameters that represent instrument data, the instrument driver functions return calculated values.
The default value is VI_FALSE. Use the tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050005
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RECORD_COERCIONS
Description Name: Record Value Coercions
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether the IVI engine keeps a list of the value coercions it makes for integer and real type attributes. You call tkdpo7k Get Next Coercion Record to extract and delete the oldest coercion record from the list.
The default value is VI_FALSE. Use the tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions function to override this value.

Attribute Value: 1050006
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_INTERCHANGE_CHECK
Description Name: Interchange Check
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether to perform interchangeability checking and retrieve interchangeability warnings.

The default value is VI_FALSE.

Interchangeability warnings indicate that using your application with a different instrument might cause different behavior. You call tkdpo7k Get Next Interchange Warning to extract interchange warnings. Call the tkdpo7k_ClearInterchangeWarnings function to clear the list of interchangeability warnings without reading them.
Interchangeability checking logs a warning for each attribute you have not set that affects the behavior of the instrument.

Attribute Value: 1050021
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_DESCRIPTION
Description Name: Description
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains a brief description of the specific driver.

Attribute Value: 1050514
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_PREFIX
Description Name: Driver Prefix
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the prefix for the instrument driver. The name of each user-callable function in this driver starts with this prefix.

Attribute Value: 1050302
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_VENDOR
Description Name: Driver Vendor
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the name of the vendor that supplies this driver.

Attribute Value: 1050513
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_REVISION
Description Name: Revision
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains additional version information about this instrument driver.

Attribute Value: 1050551
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_CLASS_SPEC_MAJOR_VERSION
Description Name: Class Specification Major Version
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: The major version number of the class specification with which this driver is compliant.

Attribute Value: 1050515
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SPECIFIC_DRIVER_CLASS_SPEC_MINOR_VERSION
Description Name: Class Specification Minor Version
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: The minor version number of the class specification with which this driver is compliant.

Attribute Value: 1050516
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SUPPORTED_INSTRUMENT_MODELS
Description Name: Supported Instrument Models
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Contains a model code of the instrument. For drivers that support more than one device, this attribute contains a comma-separated list of supported instrument models.

Attribute Value: 1050327
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_GROUP_CAPABILITIES
Description Name: Class Group Capabilities
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains a comma-separated list of class-extension groups that this driver implements.

Attribute Value: 1050401
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_INSTRUMENT_MANUFACTURER
Description Name: Manufacturer
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the name of the instrument manufacturer you are currently using.

Attribute Value: 1050511
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_INSTRUMENT_MODEL
Description Name: Model
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the model number or name of the instrument that you are currently using.

Attribute Value: 1050512
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_INSTRUMENT_FIRMWARE_REVISION
Description Name: Firmware Revision
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string that contains the firmware revision information for the instrument you are currently using.

Attribute Value: 1050510
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_LOGICAL_NAME
Description Name: Logical Name
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: A string containing the logical name you specified when opening the current IVI session.
You may pass a logical name to the tkdpo7k_init or tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions functions. The IVI Configuration utility must contain an entry for the logical name. The logical name entry refers to a virtual instrument section in the IVI Configuration file. The virtual instrument section specifies a physical device and initial user options.

Attribute Value: 1050305
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_IO_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR
Description Name: I/O Resource Descriptor
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Indicates the resource descriptor the driver uses to identify the physical device.
If you initialize the driver with a logical name, this attribute contains the resource descriptor that corresponds to the entry in the IVI Configuration utility.
If you initialize the instrument driver with the resource descriptor, this attribute contains that value.

Attribute Value: 1050304
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DRIVER_SETUP
Description Name: Driver Setup
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Some cases exist where you must specify instrument driver options at initialization time. An example of this is specifying a particular instrument model from among a family of instruments that the driver supports. This is useful when using simulation. You can specify driver-specific options through the DriverSetup keyword in the optionsString parameter to the tkdpo7k_InitWithOptions function. If you open an instrument using a logical name, you can also specify the options through the IVI Configuration Utility.
The default value is an empty string.

Attribute Value: 1050007
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_TYPE
Description Name: Acquisition Type
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrAcquisitionTypeRangeTable
Description: Specifies how the oscilloscope acquires data and fills the waveform record. When you set this attribute to TKDPO7K_VAL_ENVELOPE or TKDPO7K_VAL_PEAK_DETECT, the oscilloscope acquires minimum and maximum waveforms. To retrieve the minimum and maximum waveforms, use the tkdpo7k_ReadMinMaxWaveform and tkdpo7k_FetchMinMaxWaveform functions.

The following table describes the behavior of the oscilloscope for each acquisition type:
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Acquisition Type | Oscilloscope Behavior
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sample | Acquires one sample for each x-value in the waveform.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Peak Detect | Oversamples the input signal and keeps the minimum and maximum
| values that correspond to each x-value in the waveform record.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Hi Res | Oversamples the input signal and calculates the average value
| that corresponds to each x-value in the waveform record.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Average | Acquires multiple waveforms and keeps the minimum and maximum
| voltages it acquires for each x-value in the waveform record.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
WfmDB | Acquires and displays a waveform pixel map, which is the
| accumulation of one or more acquisitions.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Attribute Value: 1250101
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_INITIATE_CONTINUOUS
Description Name: Initiate Continuous
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: Specifies whether the oscilloscope continuously initiates waveform acquisition. If you set this attribute to VI_TRUE, the oscilloscope immediately waits for another trigger after the previous waveform acquisition is complete. Setting this attribute to VI_TRUE is useful when you require continuous updates of the oscilloscope display.

Attribute Value: 1250107
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_NUM_AVERAGES
Description Name: Number of Averages
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the number of waveforms the oscilloscope acquires and averages. After the oscilloscope acquires as many waveforms as this attribute specifies, it returns to the idle state. This attribute affects instrument behavior only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_AVERAGE.

Valid Range: 2 to 10000

Attribute Value: 1250104
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_NUM_ENVELOPES
Description Name: Number of Envelopes
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: When you set the TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_TYPE attribute to TKDPO7K_VAL_ENVELOPE, the oscilloscope acquires multiple waveforms. After each waveform acquisition, the oscilloscope keeps the minimum and maximum values it finds for each point in the waveform record. This attribute specifies the number of waveforms the oscilloscope acquires and analyzes to create the minimum and maximum waveforms. After the oscilloscope acquires as many waveforms as this attribute specifies, it returns to the idle state. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_ENVELOPE.

Valid Range: 1 to 1000000000

Attribute Value: 1250105
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_NUM_SAMPLES
Description Name: Number of Samples
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the minimum number of acquired samples that make up a waveform database (WfmDB) waveform. This attribute affects instrument behavior only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_WFMDB.

Valid Range: 5000 to 1,000,000,000

Attribute Value: 1150010
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SAMPLE_MODE
Description Name: Sample Mode
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrSampleModeRangeTable
Description: Returns the sample mode the oscilloscope is currently using.

TKDPO7K_VAL_REAL_TIME (0) - Indicates that the oscilloscope is using real-time
sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_EQUIVALENT_TIME (1) - Indicates that the oscilloscope is using
equivalent-time sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_INTERPOLATE_TIME (1001) - Indicates that the oscilloscope is using
interpolate-time sampling.

Attribute Value: 1250106
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_TIME_PER_RECORD
Description Name: Horizontal Time Per Record
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the time in seconds that corresponds to the record length.

Valid Range: 250.0e-12s to 10000.0s.

Attribute Value: 1250007
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_MIN_NUM_PTS
Description Name: Horizontal Minimum Number of Points
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the minimum number of points you require in the waveform record for each channel. This instrument driver uses the value you specify to configure the record length that the oscilloscope uses for waveform acquisition. Use the TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_RECORD_LENGTH attribute to obtain the actual record length.

Attribute Value: 1250009
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_RECORD_LENGTH
Description Name: Horizontal Record Length
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Returns the actual number of points the oscilloscope acquires for each channel. The value is equal to or greater than the minimum number of points you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_MIN_NUM_PTS attribute. Allocate a ViReal64 array of this size or greater to pass as the Waveform Array parameter of the tkdpo7k_ReadWaveform and tkdpo7k_FetchWaveform functions.
Note: The oscilloscope may use different size records depending on the value you specify for the TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_TYPE attribute.

Attribute Value: 1250008
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_ACQUISITION_START_TIME
Description Name: Acquisition Start Time
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: The oscilloscope acquires the data of the length you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_TIME_PER_RECORD. This attribute specifies the starting point of the acquisition.
Negative values indicate that the oscilloscope acquires data even before the trigger event. Positive values indicate that the oscilloscope waits this amount of time before starting the acquisition.

Valid Range: -HorizontalTime/2 to 1000 - HorizontalTime/2 s.

Attribute Value: 1250109
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_HORZ_SAMPLE_RATE
Description Name: Horizontal Sample Rate
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Returns the effective digitizing rate using the current configuration. The units are samples per second.

Attribute Value: 1250010
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_CHANNEL_ENABLED
Description Name: Channel Enabled
Type: ViBoolean
RangeTable: Boolean_values
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies whether the oscilloscope acquires a waveform for a channel when you call the tkdpo7k_InitiateAcquisition, tkdpo7k_ReadWaveform, tkdpo7k_ReadMinMaxWaveform, or tkdpo7k_ReadWaveformMeasurement function.

Attribute Value: 1250005
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PROBE_ATTENUATION
Description Name: Probe Attenuation
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the scaling factor by which the probe you attach to the channel attenuates the input. For example, when you use a 10:1 probe, set this attribute to 10.0.
This driver reserves negative values to control the oscilloscope's automatic probe sense capability. Setting this attribute to TKDPO7K_VAL_PROBE_SENSE_ON configures the oscilloscope to sense the attenuation of the probe automatically. After you enable the automatic probe sense, subsequent queries of this attribute return the value TKDPO7K_VAL_PROBE_SENSE_ON. Use the TKDPO7K_ATTR_PROBE_SENSE_VALUE attribute to obtain the actual probe attenuation.
If you set the oscilloscope to sense the probe attenuation automatically, the probe attenuation value can change at any time. When the oscilloscope detects a new probe attenuation value, other settings in the oscilloscope might also change. The driver has no way of knowing when these changes occur. Therefore, when you enable the automatic probe sense capability, this driver disables caching for attributes that depend on the probe attenuation. These attributes include TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_RANGE, TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_OFFSET.
If the oscilloscope is set to sense the probe attenuation automatically, setting this attribute to a positive value disables the automatic probe sense and configures the oscilloscope to use the manual probe attenuation you specify.
If you use a manual probe attenuation, you must set this attribute to reflect the new probe attenuation each time you attach a different probe.

Attribute Value: 1250004
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PROBE_SENSE_VALUE
Description Name: Probe Sense Value
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute returns the probe attenuation value the oscilloscope automatically senses. If you disable the automatic probe sense capability, this attribute returns the manual probe attenuation setting.

Attribute Value: 1250108
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_RANGE
Description Name: Vertical Range
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the absolute value of the input range the oscilloscope can acquire for the channel. The units are volts. For example, to acquire a sine wave which spans between 0.0 and 10.0 volts, you set this attribute to 10.0 volts.

Valid Values depend on instrument models:
----------------------------------------------------
Model | Twenty OneFifty Full
----------------------------------------------------
DPO 7054 | 20e6 250e6 500e6
DPO 7104 | 20e6 250e6 1000e6
DPO 7254 | 20e6 250e6 2500e6
----------------------------------------------------

Default values depend on instrument models:
-------------------------------
Model | Default value
-------------------------------
DPO 7054 | 500e6
DPO 7104 | 1000e6
DPO 7254 | 2500e6
-------------------------------
Valid Range: The probe attenuation determines the valid range for this attribute as shown below.
When the input impedence is 50 Ohm:
(1.0e-2 * Probe Attenuation) ~ (10.0 * Probe Attenuation) volts
When the input impedence is 1M Ohm:
(1.0e-2 * Probe Attenuation) ~ (100.0 * Probe Attenuation) volts

Attribute Value: 1250001
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_OFFSET
Description Name: Vertical Offset
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the location of the center of the range that you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_RANGE attribute. Express the value in volts and with respect to ground. For example, to acquire a sine wave that spans between 0.0 and 10.0 volts, set this attribute to 5.0 volts.

Valid Range:
-----------------------------------------------------------------
Vertical Range | Offset Range
-----------------------------------------------------------------
1e-2 to 99.5e-2 | -1 to 1 V
-----------------------------------------------------------------
1 to 9.95 | -10.0 to 10.0 V
-----------------------------------------------------------------
10 to 100 | -100.0 to 100.0 V
-----------------------------------------------------------------

Attribute Value: 1250002
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_COUPLING
Description Name: Vertical Coupling
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attr7KVerticalCouplingFullRangeTable
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies how the oscilloscope couples the input signal for the channel.

Attribute Value: 1250003
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MAX_INPUT_FREQUENCY
Description Name: Max Input Frequency
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the max input frequency of the channel. Express this value as the frequency at which the input circuitry attenuates the input signal by 3 dB. The units for this attribute are hertz.

Attribute Value: 1250006
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_INPUT_IMPEDANCE
Description Name: Input Impedance
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable: attrInputImpedence_50_AND_1M_RangeTable
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the input impedance for the channel. The units are ohms.

Valid Values:
50 Ohms
1M Ohms

Attribute Value: 1250103
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_TYPE
Description Name: Trigger Type
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the trigger type.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER (1) - The oscilloscope triggers when a signal passes
through a specified voltage level in a specified
direction.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_TRIGGER (7) - The oscilloscope triggers when it detects a zero
crossing in a specified direction on the network
supply voltage.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_TRIGGER (2) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse is found
that has the specified polarity and is either
inside or outside the preset limits.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_TRIGGER (3) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse crosses the
first preset voltage threshold but does not cross
the second preset threshold before recrossing the
first.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_TRIGGER (4) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse is found
that is of the specified polarity and width.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_TRIGGER (1001) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse
crosses both thresholds in the same direction
as the specified polarity and the transition time
between the two threshold crossings is greater or
less than the specified time delta.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TIMEOUT_TRIGGER (1002) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse
train stops in the selected state for longer than
the specified time.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WINDOW_TRIGGER (1003) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse is
found that meets the conditions set by the A Event
window trigger type.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_TRIGGER (1010) - The oscilloscope triggers when the specified
logical combinations of input channels are met.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_TRIGGER (1011) - The oscilloscope triggers when the specified
conditions of channels 1, 2, and 3 are met after
the channel 4 (clock) condition is met.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STHLD_TRIGGER (1012) - The oscilloscope triggers on setup and hold
violations between a data source and a clock
source.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_TRIGGER (5) - The oscilloscope triggers when a video signal is
found.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_TRIGGER (1020) - The oscilloscope triggers when a communications
signal is found.
TKDPO7K_VAL_CAN_TRIGGER (1030) - The oscilloscope triggers when a Controller Area
Network frame signal is found.
TKDPO7K_VAL_I2C_TRIGGER (1031) - The oscilloscope triggers when an Inter-IC
Control signal is found.
TKDPO7K_VAL_SPI_TRIGGER (1032) - The oscilloscope triggers when a Serial
Peripheral Interface signal is found.
TKDPO7K_VAL_SERIAL_TRIGGER (1033) - The oscilloscope triggers when NRZ-encoded
data up to 1.25 Gbaud is found.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RS232_TRIGGER (1034) - The oscilloscope triggers when a RS232 signal
is found.

Attribute Value: 1250012
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_SOURCE
Description Name: Trigger Source
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the source the oscilloscope monitors for a trigger. Set this attribute to a channel name or to one of the values below.

Additional Trigger Sources:
TKDPO7K_VAL_EXTERNAL ("VAL_EXTERNAL") - The oscilloscope waits for a trigger on the external trigger input.

Attribute Value: 1250013
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_HOLDOFF
Description Name: Trigger Holdoff
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the length of time the oscilloscope waits after it detects a trigger until the oscilloscope enables the trigger subsystem to detect another trigger. The units are seconds.
The TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_HOLDOFF attribute affects instrument operation only when the oscilloscope requires multiple acquisitions to build a complete waveform. The oscilloscope requires multiple waveform acquisitions when it uses equivalent-time sampling or when you set the TKDPO7K_ACQUISITION_TYPE attribute to TKDPO7K_VAL_ENVELOPE or TKDPO7K_VAL_AVERAGE.

Valid Range: 0 to 12.00 seconds

Attribute Value: 1250016
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_LEVEL
Description Name: Trigger Level
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the voltage threshold for the trigger subsystem. The units are volts. This attribute affects instrument behavior only when you set the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_TYPE to the following values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_TIMEOUT_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_TRIGGER

Valid Range: The valid range for this attribute depends on the source you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_SOURCE attribute.
When you select one of the input channels as the trigger source, the values of the TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_RANGE and TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_OFFSET attributes for the channel determine the valid range. The trigger level must be:
a) <= 1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset, and
b) >= -1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset.
When you select the external trigger input as the trigger source, the valid range for this attribute is -5.0 to 5.0.

Attribute Value: 1250017
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_MODIFIER
Description Name: Trigger Modifier
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the trigger modifier. The trigger modifier determines the oscilloscope's behavior in the absence of the trigger you configure.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_NO_TRIGGER_MOD (1L) - The oscilloscope continuously waits for a valid
trigger event.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AUTO (2L) - The oscilloscope generates a trigger if it does not detect
trigger signal within a specified time period.

Attribute Value: 1250102
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_COUPLING
Description Name: Trigger Coupling
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies how the oscilloscope couples the trigger source. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC (0L) - The oscilloscope uses AC trigger coupling, which passes the
input signals above 60 Hz to the trigger circuitry.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DC (1L) - The oscilloscope uses DC trigger coupling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_HF_REJECT (3L) - The oscilloscope removes the high frequency
components of the DC signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LF_REJECT (4L) - The oscilloscope removes the low frequency components
of the DC signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_NOISE_REJECT (5L) - The oscilloscope selects DC low sensitivity. This
option requires a greater amplitude for more
stable and accurate triggering.

Attribute Value: 1250014
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_SLOPE
Description Name: Trigger Slope
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies whether a rising or a falling edge triggers the oscilloscope. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers at the rising or positive
edge of a signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_NEGATIVE (0L) - The oscilloscope triggers at the falling or negative
edge of a signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_EITHER (1001L) - The oscilloscope triggers at either the rising or
falling edge of a signal.

Attribute Value: 1250018
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_AC_LINE_TRIGGER_SLOPE
Description Name: AC Line Trigger Slope
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrACLineTriggerSlopeRangeTable
Description: Specifies whether a detection of a zero crossing occurs on the positive, negative, or either slope of the network supply voltage.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers at the rising or
positive edge of a signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_NEGATIVE (2L) - The oscilloscope triggers at the falling or
negative edge of a signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_EITHER (3L) - The oscilloscope triggers at either the rising
or the falling edge of a signal.

Attribute Value: 1250701
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_CONDITION
Description Name: Glitch Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies glitch condition. This attribute determines whether the glitch trigger occurs when the oscilloscope detects a pulse with a width that is less than or greater than the glitch width value. You specify the glitch width with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_WIDTH attribute.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_LESS_THAN (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers when the pulse width
is greater than the value you specify with the
Glitch Width attribute.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_GREATER_THAN (2L) - The scilloscope triggers when the pulse
width is less than the value you specify with
the Glitch Width attribute.

Attribute Value: 1250403
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_WIDTH
Description Name: Glitch Width
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the glitch width. The units are seconds. The oscilloscope triggers when it detects a pulse with a width that is less than or more than the value you specify.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1250401
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_POLARITY
Description Name: Glitch Polarity
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the polarity of the glitch that triggers the oscilloscope.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers with a positive
glitch.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_NEGATIVE (2L) - The oscilloscope triggers with a negative
glitch.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_EITHER (3L) - The oscilloscope triggers with either a positive
glitch or a negative glitch.

Attribute Value: 1250402
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_TRIGGERIF
Description Name: Glitch Trigger If
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the condition the glitch trigger must meet before a trigger is set.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_OCCURS (0L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if any detectable event
occurs.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC (1L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if the individual channel
qualifications meet the logic patterns and logic input
thresholds. If you select this value, use the
tkdpo7k_ConfigurePatternTrigger function and the
tkdpo7k_ConfigurePatternTriggerInput function to
configure logic pattern parameters.

Attribute Value: 1150012
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_CONDITION
Description Name: Width Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies whether a pulse that is within or outside the high and low thresholds triggers the oscilloscope. You specify the high and low thresholds with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_HIGH_THRESHOLD and TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_LOW_THRESHOLD attributes.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_WITHIN (1L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when the
pulse has the duration between the Low Threshold
and the High Threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_OUTSIDE (2L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when the
pulse has the duration outside the Low Threshold
and the High Threshold.

RangeTable:

TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_NEGATIVE (2L) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger on a

TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC (1L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if the individual channel

Attribute Value: 1150013
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_CONDITION
Description Name: Runt Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the runt condition. This attributes determines whether the runt trigger occurs when the oscilloscope detects a pulse going through one voltage threshold but fails to cross a second threshold before re-crossing the first.

TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_OCCURS (0L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when a
runt of any detectable width occurs.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_WIDER_THAN (1L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when a
runt with a width greater than the width you
specify in the Runt Width attribute occurs.

Attribute Value: 1150014
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Runt High Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the high threshold the oscilloscope uses for runt triggering. The units are volts.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Note:
If you pass value for this attribute less than value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD attribute, the driver coerces value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD attribute to the same value.

Attribute Value: 1250301
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Runt Low Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the low threshold the oscilloscope uses for runt triggering. The units are volts.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Note:
If you pass value for this attribute higher than value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD attribute, the driver coerces value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD attribute to the same value.

Attribute Value: 1250302
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_POLARITY
Description Name: Runt Polarity
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the polarity of the runt that triggers the oscilloscope.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers on a positive runt. A
positive runt occurs when a rising edge crosses
the lower runt threshold and does not cross the
upper runt threshold before re-crossing the lower
runt threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_NEGATIVE (2L) - The oscilloscope triggers on a negative runt. A
negative runt occurs when a falling edge crosses
the upper runt threshold and does not cross the
lower runt threshold before re-crossing the upper
runt threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_EITHER (3L) - The oscilloscope triggers on either a positive or
negative runt.

Attribute Value: 1250303
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_WIDTH
Description Name: Runt Width
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the minimum pulse width that the oscilloscope checks for triggering when it detects a runt. This attribute is effective only when the Runt Condition attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_WIDER_THAN.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1150019
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_CONDITION
Description Name: Transition Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies whether to check for a slewing signal that is faster or slower than the specified delta time. Delta time can be set through TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_DELTA_TIME attribute.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_FASTER (0) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when
the transitioning signal is faster than the
specified delta time.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_SLOWER (1) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when
the transitioning signal is slower than the
specified delta time.

Attribute Value: 1150020
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_HIGH_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Transition High Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the upper (most positive) limit of the two threshold levels that a pulse edge must traverse for the transition trigger to occur.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Note:
If you pass value for this attribute less than value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_LOW_THRESHOLD attribute, the driver coerces value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_LOW_THRESHOLD attribute to the same value.

Attribute Value: 1150021
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_LOW_THRESHOLD

Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Note:
If you pass value for this attribute higher than value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_HIGH_THRESHOLD attribute, the driver coerces value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_HIGH_THRESHOLD attribute to the same value.

Description Name: Transition Delta Time
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies delta time (between high and low threshold levels) that the oscilloscope uses to compute transition. Units are seconds.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1150023
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRANSITION_POLARITY

Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the polarity for the pulse transition trigger.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_POSITIVE (0) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when
a pulse edge traverses from the Lower Level
to the Upper Level.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_NEGATIVE (1) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when
a pulse edge traverses from the Upper Level
to the Lower Level.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_EITHER (2) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when a
pulse edge either traverses from the Lower
Level to the Upper Level or from the Upper
Level to the Lower Level.

Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:

Valid Values:

TKDPO7K_VAL_WINDOW_EXIT (1) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when a pulse

window violation is greater than the specified

TKDPO7K_VAL_WINDOW_OUTSIDE (3) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when a
window violation is greater than the specified

the Upper Level and Lower Level thresholds

Attribute Value: 1150030
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_CONDITION
Description Name: Pattern Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the condition for generating a logic pattern trigger with respect to the defined input pattern.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_TRUE (0) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the

TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_FALSE (1) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the

TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_LESSTHAN (2) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the

TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_MORETHAN (3) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the

the Pattern More Than attribute.

Attribute Value: 1150031
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_INPUT_LEVEL
Description Name: Pattern Input Level
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the logic pattern trigger input level for the specified channel.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Attribute Value: 1150032
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_INPUT_POLARITY
Description Name: Pattern Input Poloarity
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: This channel-based attribute specifies the logic pattern trigger input polarity for the specified channel.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_HIGH (0) - Specifies the logical high voltage level.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_LOW (1) - Specifies the logical low voltage level.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_EITHER (2) - Specifies either the logical high or the logical
low voltage level.

Attribute Value: 1150033
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_FUNCTION
Description Name: Pattern Function
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the logical combination of the input channels for the logic pattern triggers.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_AND (0) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when all
conditions are true.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_NAND (1) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when any of
the conditions are false.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_NOR (2) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when all
conditions are false.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_OR (3) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when any of the
conditions are true.

Attribute Value: 1150034
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_LESS_TIME
Description Name: Pattern Less Time
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the maximum time the selected pattern may be true and still generate a main logic pattern trigger. You use this attributes to configure the oscilloscope after you set the TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_CONDITION to TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_LESSTHAN.

Units: seconds.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1150035
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_MORE_TIME
Description Name: Pattern More Time
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the minimum time the selected pattern may be true and still generate a main logic pattern trigger. You use this attributes to configure the oscilloscope after you set the TKDPO7K_ATTR_PATTERN_CONDITION to TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_MORETHAN.

Units: seconds.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1150036
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_STATE_CONDITION
Description Name: State Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the logic state condition for generating a logic state trigger.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_TRUE (0) - The oscilloscope triggers when the clock transition
occurs and the pattern of other channels are at the
desired logic input states.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_FALSE (1) - The oscilloscope triggers when the desired clock
transition occurs and the desired logic input states
on other channels are not found.

Attribute Value: 1150039
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_STATE_CLOCK_EDGE
Description Name: State Clock Edge
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the main logic trigger input for channel 4 (or channel 2 for two-channel instruments). It specifies whether a rising or a falling edge triggers the logic state trigger input for channel 4(or channel 2 for two-channel instruments). This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_TRIGGER.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_CLOCK_RISE (0) - For 4-channel oscilloscopes, configures the
oscilloscope to trigger when the clock
transition on Channel 4 occurs and the logical
input states on Channel 1-3 are not met. For
2-channel oscilloscopes, this parameter
configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the
clock transition on Channel 2 occurs and the
logical input state on Channel 1 is not met.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_CLOCK_FALL (1) - For 4-channel oscilloscopes, configures the
oscilloscope to trigger when the clock
transition on Channel 4 occurs and the logical
input states on Channel 1-3 are met. For
2-channel instruments, this parameter
configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the
clock transition on Channel 2 occurs and the
logical input state on Channel 1 is met.

TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC_OR (3) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when any of the

Attribute Value: 1150048
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_SETHOLD_TRIGGERIF
Description Name: Sethold Trigger If
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the condition the setup and hold trigger must meet before a trigger is set.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_OCCURS (0L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if any detectable event
occurs.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC (1L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if the individual channel
qualifications meet the logic patterns and logic input
thresholds. If you select this value, use the
tkdpo7k_ConfigurePatternTrigger function and the
tkdpo7k_ConfigurePatternTriggerInput function to
configure logic pattern parameters.

Attribute Value: 1150049
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_COMM_SOURCE_TYPE
Description Name: Communication Source Type
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the communication trigger source type. This attribute is effective only when you set the Communication Pulse Form attribute to Eye Diagram.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_SOURCE_DATA (0) - The oscilloscope triggers and shifts five unit
intervals to form the expected eye pattern.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_SOURCE_CLOCK (1) - The oscilloscope triggers but no shift occurs.
The clock type causes random triggers with
respect to the data channel which must be one
of the other three channels.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_SOURCE_RCLK (2) - The oscilloscope recovers a clock from the data
signal on the source using a phase locked loop.
Triggers based on the recovered clock are
random with respect to the data. So the
waveform is not shifted.

frame.

Description: Specifies the CAN Trigger threshold for the CAN data source.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Attribute Value: 1150065
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_CAN_DATA_VALUE
Description Name: CAN Data Value
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the binary data string as data value used for CAN Trigger. It is effective only when you set the CAN Condition attribute to Data or Identifier and Data.

Valid Format: You can specify 0 (dominant bit), 1 (recessive bit) or X (do not care) to each bit with a total length of no more than 64 bits (8 bytes).

For example, if you specify the value as XX1100, the oscilloscope triggers when detecting data equal to 0 in the first two bits and 1 in the next two bits. Higher bits are ignored. So the oscilloscope triggers on both CAN frames with values of 001100 and 111100.

Default Value: 01

Attribute Value: 1150066
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_CAN_DATA_DIRECTION
Description Name: CAN Data Direction
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the CAN trigger condition to be valid on a Read, Write or Either.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_CAN_DATA_READ (0) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger on the READ
package of CAN data frame.
TKDPO7K_VAL_CAN_DATA_WRITE (1) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger on the
WRITE package of CAN data frame.
TKDPO7K_VAL_CAN_DATA_NOCARE (2) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger on either
the READ package or WRITE package of CAN data
frame.

Attribute Value: 1150110
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_TYPE
Description Name: Delay Trigger Type
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the delay trigger type.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER (1) - The oscilloscope triggers when a signal passes
through a specified voltage level in a specified
direction.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_TRIGGER (2) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse is found
that has the specified polarity and is either
inside or outside the preset limits.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_TRIGGER (3) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse crosses the
first preset voltage threshold but does not cross
the second preset threshold before recrossing the
first.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_TRIGGER (4) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse is found
that is of the specified polarity and width.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TRANSITION_TRIGGER (1001) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse
crosses both thresholds in the same direction
as the specified polarity and the transition time
between the two threshold crossings is greater or
less than the specified time delta.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TIMEOUT_TRIGGER (1002) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse
train stops in the selected state for longer than
the specified time.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WINDOW_TRIGGER (1003) - The oscilloscope triggers when a pulse is
found that meets the conditions set by the A Event
window trigger type.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_TRIGGER (1010) - The oscilloscope triggers when the specified
logical combinations of input channels are met.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_TRIGGER (1011) - The oscilloscope triggers when the specified
conditions of channels 1, 2, and 3 are met after
the channel 4 (clock) condition is met.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STHLD_TRIGGER (1012) - The oscilloscope triggers on setup and hold
violations between a data source and a clock
source.

Attribute Value: 1150111
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_SOURCE
Description Name: Delay Trigger Source
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the source the oscilloscope monitors for a delay trigger. Set this attribute to a channel name or to one of the values below.

Additional Trigger Sources:
TKDPO7K_VAL_EXTERNAL ("VAL_EXTERNAL") - The oscilloscope waits for a trigger on the external trigger input.

Attribute Value: 1150112
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_LEVEL
Description Name: Delay Trigger Level
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the voltage threshold for the delay trigger subsystem. The units are volts. This attribute affects instrument behavior only when you set the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_TYPE to the following values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_TRIGGER
TKDPO7K_VAL_TIMEOUT_TRIGGER

Valid Range: The valid range for this attribute depends on the source you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_SOURCE attribute.
When you select one of the input channels as the trigger source, the values of the TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_RANGE and TKDPO7K_ATTR_VERTICAL_OFFSET attributes for the channel determine the valid range. The trigger level must be:
a) <= 1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset, and
b) >= -1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset.
When you select the external trigger input as the trigger source, the valid range for this attribute is -5.0 to 5.0.

Attribute Value: 1150113
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_STATE
Description Name: Delay Trigger State
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrDelayTriggerStateRangeTable
Description: Specifies the state of delay trigger activity. If the delay trigger state
is on, the delay trigger is part of the triggering sequence. If the delay trigger state is off, then only the immediate trigger causes the trigger event.

Attribute Value: 1150116
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_MODE
Description Name: Delay Trigger Mode
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrDelayTriggerModeRangeTable
Description: Specifies whether the delay trigger occurs after a specified
number of events or a specified period of time after the immediate trigger.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_DELAY_BY_TIME (0) - The oscilloscope waits for time period specified
by the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_DELAY_TIME
attribute after receiving the main trigger before
looking for a trigger from the delay trigger
source.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DELAY_BY_EVENTS (1) - The oscilloscope waits for a certain number of
events specified by the
TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_DELAY_EVENT after
receiving the main trigger before acquiring data.

Attribute Value: 1150117
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_DELAY_TIME
Description Name: Delay Trigger Delay Time
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the time, in seconds, to wait after receiving the main trigger and before looking for the delay trigger event. This attribute is effective only when
you set the Delay Trigger Mode to TKDPO7K_VAL_DELAY_BY_TIME.

Valid Range: 3.2E-9 ~ 3.0E6 s

Attribute Value: 1150118
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_DELAY_EVENT
Description Name: Delay Trigger Delay Event
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the number of main trigger events that occur after the main trigger and before the oscilloscope looks for the delay trigger event. This attribute is effective only when you set the Delay Trigger Mode to TKDPO7K_VAL_DELAY_BY_EVENTS.

Valid Range: 1 ~ 10,000,000.

Attribute Value: 1150119
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_COUPLING
Description Name: Delay Trigger Coupling
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies how the oscilloscope couples the delay trigger source. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC (0L) - The oscilloscope uses AC trigger coupling, which passes the
input signals above 60 Hz to the trigger circuitry.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DC (1L) - The oscilloscope uses DC trigger coupling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_HF_REJECT (3L) - The oscilloscope removes the high frequency
components of the DC signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LF_REJECT (4L) - The oscilloscope removes the low frequency components
of the DC signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_NOISE_REJECT (5L) - The oscilloscope selects DC low sensitivity. This
option requires a greater amplitude for more
stable and accurate triggering.

Attribute Value: 1150120
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_SLOPE
Description Name: Delay Trigger Slope
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies whether a rising or a falling edge triggers the oscilloscope. This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers at the rising or positive
edge of a signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_NEGATIVE (0L) - The oscilloscope triggers at the falling or negative
edge of a signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_EITHER (1001L) - The oscilloscope triggers at either the rising or
falling edge of a signal.

Attribute Value: 1150121
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_GLITCH_CONDITION
Description Name: Delay Glitch Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies delay glitch condition. This attribute determines whether the glitch trigger occurs when the oscilloscope detects a pulse with a width that is less than or greater than the glitch width value. You specify the glitch width with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_GLITCH_WIDTH attribute.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_LESS_THAN (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers when the pulse width
is greater than the value you specify with the
Delay Glitch Width attribute.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_GREATER_THAN (2L) - The scilloscope triggers when the pulse
width is less than the value you specify with
the Delay Glitch Width attribute.

Attribute Value: 1150125
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_GLITCH_WIDTH
Description Name: Delay Glitch Width
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the delay glitch width. The units are seconds. The oscilloscope triggers when it detects a pulse with a width that is less than or more than the value you specify.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1150123
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_GLITCH_POLARITY
Description Name: Delay Glitch Polarity
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the polarity of the glitch that triggers the oscilloscope.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers with a positive
glitch.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_NEGATIVE (2L) - The oscilloscope triggers with a negative
glitch.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_EITHER (3L) - The oscilloscope triggers with either a positive
glitch or a negative glitch.

Attribute Value: 1150124
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_GLITCH_TRIGGERIF
Description Name: Delay Glitch Trigger If
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the condition the delay glitch trigger must meet before a trigger is set.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_OCCURS (0L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if any detectable event
occurs.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC (1L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if the individual channel
qualifications meet the logic patterns and logic input
thresholds. If you select this value, use the
tkdpo7k_ConfigureDelayPatternTrigger function and the
tkdpo7k_ConfigureDelayPatternTriggerInput function to
configure logic pattern parameters.

Attribute Value: 1150126
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_WIDTH_CONDITION
Description Name: Delay Width Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies whether a pulse that is within or outside the high and low thresholds triggers the oscilloscope. You specify the high and low thresholds with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_WIDTH_HIGH_THRESHOLD and TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_WIDTH_LOW_THRESHOLD attributes.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_WITHIN (1L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when the
pulse has the duration between the Delay Low
Threshold and the Delay High Threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_OUTSIDE (2L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when the
pulse has the duration outside the Delay Low
Threshold and the Delay High Threshold.

Attribute Value: 1150127
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_WIDTH_HIGH_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Delay Width High Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the delay high width threshold time. The units are seconds.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Attribute Value: 1150128
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_WIDTH_LOW_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Delay Width Low Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the delay low width threshold time. The units are seconds.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_NEGATIVE (2L) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger on a

TKDPO7K_VAL_LOGIC (1L) - Specifies that a trigger is set if the individual channel

Attribute Value: 1150131
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_CONDITION
Description Name: Delay Runt Condition
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the delay runt condition. This attributes determines whether the delay runt trigger occurs when the oscilloscope detects a pulse going through one voltage threshold but fails to cross a second threshold before re-crossing the first.

TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_OCCURS (0L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when a
runt of any detectable width occurs.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_WIDER_THAN (1L) - Specifies that the oscilloscope triggers when a
runt with a width greater than the width you
specify in the Delay Runt Width attribute occurs.

Attribute Value: 1150132
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Delay Runt High Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the high threshold the oscilloscope uses for delay runt triggering. The units are volts.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Note:
If you pass value for this attribute less than value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD attribute, the driver coerces value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD attribute to the same value.

Attribute Value: 1150133
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD
Description Name: Runt Low Threshold
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the low threshold the oscilloscope uses for delay runt triggering. The units are volts.

Valid Range:
(-1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset) ~ (1.2 * VerticalRange + VerticalOffset)

Note:
If you pass value for this attribute higher than value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD attribute, the driver coerces value of TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD attribute to the same value.

Attribute Value: 1150134
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_POLARITY
Description Name: Runt Polarity
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the polarity of the runt that triggers the oscilloscope.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_POSITIVE (1L) - The oscilloscope triggers on a positive runt. A
positive runt occurs when a rising edge crosses
the lower runt threshold and does not cross the
upper runt threshold before re-crossing the lower
runt threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_NEGATIVE (2L) - The oscilloscope triggers on a negative runt. A
negative runt occurs when a falling edge crosses
the upper runt threshold and does not cross the
lower runt threshold before re-crossing the upper
runt threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_EITHER (3L) - The oscilloscope triggers on either a positive or
negative runt.

Attribute Value: 1150135
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_RUNT_WIDTH
Description Name: Runt Width
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the minimum pulse width that the oscilloscope checks for delay triggering when it detects a runt. This attribute is effective only when the Delay Runt Condition attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_WIDER_THAN.

Valid Range: 300.0e-12 to 1 s

Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:

RangeTable:

TKDPO7K_VAL_PATTERN_MORETHAN (3) - Configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the
specific pattern is true more than the time set by

Attribute Value: 1150160
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_STATE_CLOCK_EDGE
Description Name: Delay State Clock Edge
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable:
Description: This attribute specifies the main logic trigger input for channel 4 (or channel 2 for two-channel instruments). It specifies whether a rising or a falling edge triggers the delay state trigger input for channel 4(or channel 2 for two-channel instruments). This attribute affects instrument operation only when the TKDPO7K_ATTR_DELAY_TRIGGER_TYPE attribute is set to TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_TRIGGER.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_CLOCK_RISE (0) - For 4-channel oscilloscopes, configures the
oscilloscope to trigger when the clock
transition on Channel 4 occurs and the logical
input states on Channel 1-3 are not met. For
2-channel oscilloscopes, this parameter
configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the
clock transition on Channel 2 occurs and the
logical input state on Channel 1 is not met.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STATE_CLOCK_FALL (1) - For 4-channel oscilloscopes, configures the
oscilloscope to trigger when the clock
transition on Channel 4 occurs and the logical
input states on Channel 1-3 are met. For
2-channel instruments, this parameter
configures the oscilloscope to trigger when the
clock transition on Channel 2 occurs and the
logical input state on Channel 1 is met.

Attribute Value: 1150170
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MEAS_HIGH_REF
Description Name: Measurement High Reference
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the high reference the oscilloscope uses for waveform measurements. The value is a percentage of the difference between the Voltage High and Voltage Low. The oscilloscope calculates the Voltage High and the Voltage Low using either the min/max or histogram methods. The min/max method uses the maximum and minimum values found. The histogram method uses the most common values found above and below the middle of the waveform.

Valid Range: 0.0 to 100.0

Attribute Value: 1250607
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MEAS_LOW_REF
Description Name: Measurement Low Reference
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the low reference the oscilloscope uses for waveform measurements. The value is a percentage of the difference between the Voltage High and Voltage Low. The oscilloscope calculates the Voltage High and the Voltage Low using either the min/max or histogram methods. The min/max method uses the maximum and minimum values found. The histogram method uses the most common values found above and below the middle of the waveform.

Valid Range: 0.0 to 100.0

Attribute Value: 1250608
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MEAS_MID_REF
Description Name: Measurement Mid Reference
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the mid reference the oscilloscope uses for waveform measurements. The value is a percentage of the difference between the Voltage High and Voltage Low. The oscilloscope calculates the Voltage High and the Voltage Low using either the min/max or histogram methods. The min/max method uses the maximum and minimum values found. The histogram method uses the most common values found above and below the middle of the waveform.

Valid Range: 0.0 to 100.0

Attribute Value: 1250609
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MEAS_MID2_REF
Description Name: Measurement Mid2 Reference
Type: ViReal64
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the mid reference level for the "to" waveform when taking a delay measurement or phase measurement. The value is a percentage of the difference between the Voltage High and Voltage Low. The oscilloscope calculates the Voltage High and the Voltage Low using either the min/max or histogram method. The min/max method uses the maximum and minimum values found. The histogram method uses the most common values found above and below the middle of the waveform.

Valid Range: 0.0 to 100.0

Attribute Value: 1150171
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MEAS_REF_CALC_METHOD
Description Name: Measurement Reference Calculate Method
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrMeasMethodRangeTable
Description: Specifies the method the oscilloscope uses to calculate the voltages corresponding to the 0.0% and 100.0% reference levels.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_MEAS_HISTOGRAM (0) - Sets the 100.0% and 0.0% waveform levels
statistically using a histogram algorithm.
TKDPO7K_VAL_MEAS_MEAN (1) - Sets the high and low reference levels to the mean
values using all values either above or below the
midpoint.
TKDPO7K_VAL_MEAS_MINMAX (2) - Sets the 100.0% and 0.0% waveform levels to the
maximum and minimum values of the waveform,
respectively.

Attribute Value: 1150172
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MEAS_FUNCTION
Description Name: Measurement Function
Type: ViInt32
RangeTable: attrMeasFunctionRangeTable
Description: Specifies the waveform measurement you want the oscilloscope to perform.

Valid Values:
TKDPO7K_VAL_AMPLITUDE (15) - The amplitude of the selected waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_HIGH (8) - The High reference, or 100% level, of the waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_LOW (9) - The Low reference, or 0% level, of the waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_RMS (4) - The true Root Mean Square voltage in the entire
waveform or gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_MAX (6) - The maximum amplitude of the waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_MIN (7) - The minimum amplitude of the waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_PEAK_TO_PEAK (5) - The absolute difference between the maximum
and minimum amplitude in the entire waveform or
gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_CYCLE_RMS (16) - The true RMS voltage over the first cycle in
the waveform or the first cycle in the gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_OVERSHOOT (18) - The positive overshoot value over the entire waveform
or gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PRESHOOT (19) - The negative overshoot value over the entire waveform
or gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_AVERAGE (10) - The arithmetic mean over the entire waveform or
gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_VOLTAGE_CYCLE_AVERAGE (17) - The arithmetic mean over the first cycle
in the waveform or the first cycle in the gated
region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RISE_TIME (0) - The rise time of a waveform. The rise time is the time
it takes for the leading edge of the first pulse
encountered to rise from a low reference value to a
high reference value.
TKDPO7K_VAL_FALL_TIME (1) - The time taken for the falling edge of the first pulse
in the waveform or gated region to fall from a high
reference value to a low reference value.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_POS (12) - The distance, in percentage of time, between the
middle reference amplitude points of a positive
pulse.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_NEG (11) - The distance, in percentage of time, between the
middle reference amplitude points of a negative
pulse.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PERIOD (3) - The time required to complete the first cycle in a
waveform or gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_FREQUENCY (2) - The first cycle in the waveform or gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DELAY (1001) - The percentage time between the middle reference
amplitude point of the source waveform and the
destination waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DUTY_CYCLE_POS (14) - The percentage ratio of the positive pulse width
to the signal period.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DUTY_CYCLE_NEG (13) - The percentage ratio of the negative pulse width
to the signal period.
TKDPO7K_VAL_CROSS_POS (1002) - The time from the trigger point to the first
positive edge of the waveform or gated region. The
distance (time) is measured at the middle reference
amplitude point of the signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_CROSS_NEG (1003) - The time from the trigger point to the first
falling edge of the waveform or gated region. The
distance (time) is measured at the middle reference
amplitude point of the signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_HISTO_WAVEFORM_COUNT (1004) - The number of waveforms used to
calculate the histogram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_HISTO_HITS (1005) - The number of points in or on the histogram box.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PEAK_HITS (1006) - The peak-to-peak difference of the histogram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_MEDIAN (1007) - The middle point of the histogram box.
TKDPO7K_VAL_MAXIMUM (1008) - The voltage of the highest nonzero bin in vertical
histograms or the time of the right-most nonzero bin
in horizontal histograms.
TKDPO7K_VAL_MINIMUM (1009) - The lowest nonzero bin in vertical histograms or the
time of the left-most nonzero bin in horizontal
histograms.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PEAK_TO_PEAK (1010) - The peak-to-peak difference of the histogram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_MEAN (1011) - The average of all points in or on the histogram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_STD_DEVIATION (1012) - The Root Mean Square (RMS) deviation of all
points in or on the histogram box.
TKDPO7K_VAL_SIGMA1 (1013) - The percentage of points in the histogram that are
within one standard deviation of the histogram mean.
TKDPO7K_VAL_SIGMA2 (1014) - The percentage of points in the histogram that are
within two standard deviations of the histogram mean.
TKDPO7K_VAL_SIGMA3 (1015) - The percentage of points in the histogram that are
within three standard deviations of the histogram
mean.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EXT_RATIO (1016) - The extinction ratio of the optical waveform.
The extinction ratio also is called the eye diagram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EXT_RATIO_PCT (1017) - The percentage ratio of the average power
levels for the logical Low, or Off, state to the
logical High, or On, state of the optical waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EXT_RATIO_DB (1018) - The extinction ratio of the optical
waveform.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EYE_HEIGHT (1019) - The vertical opening, in volts, of the eye
diagram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EYE_WIDTH (1020) - The width, in seconds, of the eye diagram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EYE_TOP (1021) - The top value used in extinction ratio
measurements.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_EYE_BASE (1022) - The base value used in extinction ratio
measurements.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_CROSSING_PCT (1023) - The location of the eye crossing point and
expresses the value as a percentage of the Eye
Height.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_JITTER_PKPK (1024) - The variance, or the minimum and maximum
values, in the time locations of the cross point.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_JITTER_RMS (1025) - The variance in the time locations of the
cross point.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_JITTER_6SIGMA (1026) - 6 times the Jitter RMS of the eye diagram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_NOISE_PKPK (1027) - The variance (minimum and maximum values) in
the time locations of the cross point.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_NOISE_RMS (1028) - The Root Mean Square (RMS) noise amplitude on
the waveform at the mid-reference level.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_SN_RATIO (1029) - The signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) of the eye
diagram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_CYCLE_DIST (1030) - The time between the falling edge and the
rising edge of the eye pattern at the mid-reference
level.
TKDPO7K_VAL_COMM_QUALITY_FACTOR (1031) - The quality factor of the eye diagram.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AREA (1032) - The voltage over time. The area is over the entire
waveform or gated region and is measured in
volt-seconds.
TKDPO7K_VAL_CYCLE_AREA (1033) - The voltage over time. In other words, it
measures, in volt-seconds, the area over the first
cycle in the waveform or the first cycle in the
gated region.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PHASE (1034) - The phase difference, or the amount of time a waveform
leads or lags the reference waveform, between two
waveforms.
TKDPO7K_VAL_BURST_WIDTH (1035) - The duration of a burst.

Attribute Value: 1150182
Const Name: TKDPO7K_ATTR_MATH_DEFINE
Description Name: Math Define
Type: ViString
RangeTable:
Description: Specifies the advanced math function as a text string. You can specify a math expression from waveforms, measurements and scalar sources, functions, operands, and numerical constants. Math expressions can be very complex. As an example, you can enter the expression LOG(Ch1+Ch2), which specifies that the signals from channels 1 and 2 are to be algebraically added, and the base 10 log of the sum is to be shown as the final math waveform.

attrAcquisitionTypeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_NORMAL 0 Sets the oscilloscope to the normal acquisition mode. The oscilloscope acquires one sample for each point in the waveform record. The oscilloscope can use real-time or equivalent-time sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_PEAK_DETECT 1 Sets the oscilloscope to the peak-detect acquisition mode. The oscilloscope oversamples the input signal and keeps the minimum and maximum values that correspond to each position in the waveform record. The oscilloscope uses only real-time sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_HI_RES 2 Sets the oscilloscope to the high-resolution acquisition mode. The oscilloscope oversamples the input signal and calculates an average value for each position in the waveform record. The oscilloscope uses only real-time sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_ENVELOPE 3 Sets the oscilloscope to the envelope acquisition mode. The oscilloscope acquires multiple waveforms and keeps the minimum and maximum voltages it acquires for each point in the waveform record. You specify the number of waveforms the oscilloscope acquires with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_NUM_ENVELOPES attribute. The oscilloscope can use real-time or equivalent-time sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AVERAGE 4 Sets the oscilloscope to the average acquisition mode. The oscilloscope acquires multiple waveforms and calculates an average value for each point in the waveform record. You specify the number of waveforms the oscilloscope acquires with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_NUM_AVERAGES attribute. The oscilloscope can use real-time or equivalent-time sampling.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WFMDB 1001 Set the oscilloscope to the waveform database mode. The oscilloscope acquires and displays a waveform pixel map, which is the accumulation of one or more acquisitions.

attrInterpolationRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_NO_INTERPOLATION 1 The oscilloscope does not interpolate points in the waveform. Instead, the driver sets every element in the waveform array for which the oscilloscope cannot resolve a value to TKDPO7K_VAL_INVALID_WFM_VOLTAGE.
TKDPO7K_VAL_SINE_X 2 sin(x)/x interpolation
TKDPO7K_VAL_LINEAR 3 Linear interpolation
attrTriggerCouplingRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC 0 The oscilloscope AC couples the trigger signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_DC 1 The oscilloscope DC couples the trigger signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_LF_REJECT 3 The oscilloscope filters the low frequencies from the trigger signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_HF_REJECT 4 The oscilloscope filters the high frequencies from the trigger signal.
TKDPO7K_VAL_NOISE_REJECT 5 The oscilloscope filters the noise from the trigger signal.
attrTriggerTypeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_EDGE_TRIGGER 1 Configures the oscilloscope for edge triggering. An edge trigger occurs when the trigger signal passes through the voltage threshold that you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_LEVEL attribute and has the slope that you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_SLOPE attribute.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_TRIGGER 3 Configures the oscilloscope for runt triggering. A runt trigger occurs when the trigger signal crosses one of the runt thresholds twice without crossing the other runt threshold. You specify the runt thresholds with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_HIGH_THRESHOLD and TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_LOW_THRESHOLD attributes. You specify the polarity of the runt with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_RUNT_POLARITY attribute.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_TRIGGER 4 Configures the oscilloscope for glitch triggering. A glitch trigger occurs when the trigger signal has a pulse with a width that is less than or greater than the glitch width. You specify the glitch width with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_WIDTH attribute. You specify the polarity of the pulse with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_POLARITY attribute. You specify the condition with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_GLITCH_CONDITION attribute. The trigger does not actually occur until the edge of a pulse that corresponds to the glitch width and polarity you specify crosses the trigger level you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_LEVEL attribute.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_TRIGGER 2 Configures the oscilloscope for width triggering. A width trigger occurs when the oscilloscope detects a positive or negative pulse with a width between, or optionally outside, the width thresholds. You specify the width thresholds with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_HIGH_THRESHOLD and TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_LOW_THRESHOLD attributes. You specify whether the oscilloscope triggers on pulse widths that are within or outside the width thresholds with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_CONDITION attribute. You specify the polarity of the pulse with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_WIDTH_POLARITY attribute. The trigger does not actually occur until the edge of a pulse that corresponds to the width thresholds, width condition, and polarity you specify crosses the trigger level you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TRIGGER_LEVEL attribute.
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_TRIGGER 5 Configures the oscilloscope for TV triggering. You configure the TV trigger with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TV_TRIGGER_SIGNAL_FORMAT, TKDPO7K_ATTR_TV_TRIGGER_EVENT, TKDPO7K_ATTR_TV_TRIGGER_LINE_NUMBER, and TKDPO7K_ATTR_TV_TRIGGER_POLARITY attributes.
TKDPO7K_VAL_IMMEDIATE_TRIGGER 6 Configures the oscilloscope to tdigitize without waiting on trigger.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_TRIGGER 7 Configures the oscilloscope for triggering on the zero crossings of the network supply voltage.
attrTvTriggerEventRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_EVENT_FIELD1 1 Field 1 of the video signal
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_EVENT_FIELD2 2 Field 2 of the video signal
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_EVENT_ANY_FIELD 3 Any field of the video signal
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_EVENT_ANY_LINE 4 Any line of the video signal
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_EVENT_LINE_NUMBER 5 The line of the video signal you specify with the TKDPO7K_ATTR_TV_TRIGGER_LINE_NUMBER attribute.
attrTriggerModifierRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_NO_TRIGGER_MOD 1 The oscilloscope waits indefinitely for the trigger you specify.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AUTO 2 If the trigger you specify does not occur within the oscilloscope's timeout period, the oscilloscope automatically triggers.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AUTO_LEVEL 3 If the trigger you specify does not occur within the oscilloscope's timeout period, the oscilloscope automatically adjusts the trigger level to a value that causes a trigger. The trigger level remains at the new value.
attrTvTriggerSignalFormatRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_NTSC 1 NTSC video signal
TKDPO7K_VAL_PAL 2 PAL video signal
TKDPO7K_VAL_SECAM 3 SECAM video signal
attrTvTriggerPolarityRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_POSITIVE 1 Positive video sync pulse
TKDPO7K_VAL_TV_NEGATIVE 2 Negative video sync pulse
attrRuntPolarityRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_POSITIVE 1 The oscilloscope triggers on a positive runt. A positive runt occurs when a rising edge crosses the low runt threshold and does not cross the high runt threshold before re-crossing the low runt threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_NEGATIVE 2 The oscilloscope triggers on a negative runt. A negative runt occurs when a falling edge crosses the high runt threshold and does not cross the low runt threshold before re-crossing the high runt threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_RUNT_EITHER 3 The oscilloscope triggers on either a positive or negative runt.
attrGlitchPolarityRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_POSITIVE 1 The oscilloscope triggers on a positive glitch.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_NEGATIVE 2 The oscilloscope triggers on a negative glitch.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_EITHER 3 The oscilloscope triggers on either a positive or negative glitch.
attrGlitchConditionRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_LESS_THAN 1 The oscilloscope triggers on pulses that have a width that is less than the specified glitch width.
TKDPO7K_VAL_GLITCH_GREATER_THAN 2 The oscilloscope triggers on pulses that have a width that is greater than the specified glitch width.
attrWidthPolarityRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_POSITIVE 1 The oscilloscope triggers on a positive pulse.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_NEGATIVE 2 The oscilloscope triggers on a negative pulse.
attrWidthConditionRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_WITHIN 1 The oscilloscope triggers on pulses that have a width that is less than the high threshold and greater than the low threshold.
TKDPO7K_VAL_WIDTH_OUTSIDE 2 The oscilloscope triggers on pulses that have a width that is either greater than the high width threshold or less than a low width threshold.
attrAcLineTriggerSlopeRangeTable
Discrete Value Actual Value Description
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_POSITIVE 1 The oscilloscope triggers on a positive zero crossing of the network supply voltage.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_NEGATIVE 2 The oscilloscope triggers on a negative zero crossing of the network supply voltage.
TKDPO7K_VAL_AC_LINE_EITHER 3 The oscilloscope triggers on either a positive or negative zero crossing of the network supply voltage.
